ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about analyzing plays, talking about identity and the role it can play in art and theatre, learned about historical figures and plays relevant to South Asian Diaspora

The course covered the history of South Asians in American performance and media, insight into the implications of what makes certain performances valuable and what doesn't, and a review of plays written by South Asian authors in the past few decades.
how to critically think about plays and critiques of them.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very interesting topic and content and readings. However, readings were rarely available on time so often felt like I wasn't getting as much out of this class as I could have been. Also, discussions and discussion questions felt a bit open ended and sometimes not very substantive.

Strengths: Shilarna is a wonderfully present and excited professor, the course material is novel and interesting in ways you would be unlikely to encounter in another course, assignments are made to reflect and engage with content in meaningful and not stressful way 

Weaknesses: the course seemed to lack focus as the semester progressed readings wouldn't be posted and it often felt like discussions were not guided in any way. it was difficult to walk away from class feeling like i had learned anything even when i did enjoy/like the readings or content beforehand.

strengths: professor stokes is incredible experienced and willing to work with you and help you learn 
weaknesses: at time the course felt a bit disorganized, some of the readings would not be posted on canvas, and it didn't feel like we learned as much as we could've.
Amazing class and amazing discussion. One of the best classes Ive taken at Yale and professor Stokes is one of the sweetest people youll meet.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, though I would caution the student would have to be vested in the material if it stays in its current form.
maybe -- depends on what you want out of a class.

extras.title: AMST 350 01/ER&M 319 01/SAST 475 01/THST 350 01 - South Asian Drama in Diaspora
